programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan cons Ben into taking dance lessons. Michael is on a downward slide academically.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: When Susan's mother comes to stay, Nick's flat suddenly becomes more attractive. Susan finds a condom in Michael's wallet.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: When the local paper announces Ben's death, he takes advantage of the situation by avoiding things he doesn't want to do.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Ben joins a poetry group when Susan discovers that a poem he wrote her years ago was not original and demands another. Nick participates in a drug trial.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan insists on traveling to Manchester for the birth of Janey's baby, and the journey triggers flashbacks of Nick's birth.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan becomes temporarily blind after a discovery at home. Ben has jury duty.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan gets into the spirit of Halloween.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan decides Ben should spend more time with Michael. Nick juggles multiple women. Janey's baby comes for a visit.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Ben and Susan have to go back to school for parenting classes. Roger becomes friends with Abi.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Ben loses his luggage on a free holiday to Lanzarote, Spain. A new camera causes complications.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Abi's father asks Ben to be his best man, and Ben contracts with Nick to give the stag night party. Michael has to do the dishes.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Roger is contagious. Nick goes into business with a python. Michael fires a rocket launcher through a window.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: After doing some Christmas shopping, the Harpers find themselves stuck in an underground train that has broken down.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Janey returns home. Susan lies to the police. Michael becomes born again. Abi confuses nature with naturism.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan tries to find a date for Roger to make Abi jealous.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan decides to run for the council. Ben enters a crossword contest. Michael gets a pet.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Ben starts thinking about his will. Nick takes a job at a funeral home.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.sub-title: A Chocolate Chip Off the Old Block
programme.desc: When Bannister loses the Grandpa Morgan Chocolate Chip Cookie account, help comes from a local bag lady who loves to bake.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Cobb's is in the middle of 'Swiss Week' but Bannister has traveling plans of his own; he's to be interviewed for a job in Italy. But there's no mention of him taking Edna. Suddenly an alarm in the store goes off and changes all his plans.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Howard is thrilled with the new video security system until he learns that one of the pieces of outmoded equipment it promises to replace is Alf Scully. Bannister's please to Mrs. Cobb go unheeded and Alf is let go. After receiving a bomb threat, Mrs. Cobb has a change of heart.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Edna has found out she's pregnant! As soon as Howard is in a good modd, she plans to tell him. Unfortunately this seems to be Howard's worst week so she's forced to tell him in less than ideal circumstances.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: When Marlene Weimaraner discovers the memo limiting coffee breaks, she threatening to take action as she recruits others to form a union. Suddenly Bannister finds himself in the middle of a 24 hour strike.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Cobb's Bingo is going great; business has never been better. The winner is promised a trip to Greece, but when Alf switches two blind men's service dogs things get crazy at the store. Now Cobb's have to figure out how they're going to send 3,000 couples to Greece.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Howard stretches the rules a little to allow a young woman to set up her sesame fruit-bar stand in the store. The other staff members soon become distracted by her beauty and Edna gets jealous.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.sub-title: A Rosenbloom by Any Other Name
programme.desc: Jennifer's raise is delayed and she has put a down payment on a car. Bannister discovers a little old lady standing in the cold. Marlene plants the idea that Jennifer isn't getting the raise because she's black.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: To get Vicky to accept his standing marriage proposal, Jack attempts to reunite Vicky's divorced parents. First appearance of Mrs. Bradford.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack thinks Vicky is pregnant, but it's E.Z.'s dog who is expecting.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: When Jack and Vicky are cast in a commercial for her airline, Jack fights with the temperamental director.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack and Vicky argue over money. Mr. Bradford offers to pay for sprinklers that Jack needs for the bistro if Jack can convince Vicky to marry him.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: With his ego bruised after to losing a trivia game to Vicky, Jack tries to best her but ends up embarrassing himself at a beach carnival in front of guests.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Aboard a flight to Acapulco, Jack mistakes an air marshal for a hijacker. When they arrive, Jack crashes their vacation.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack's old friend, Larry invites him to a swinging party where an old flame makes a move on Jack.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: After Jack and James get drunk together, James is arrested for urinating in public and ends up in court.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack grooms E.Z. for a date with a high-class girl who only seems interested in Jack.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: James tries to match his ex-wife with a business acquaintance, hoping to cease paying her alimony.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: The Brookes are expecting a Congressman to drop by and Jeffrey doesn't want the Ropers around when he comes.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Stanley's physical checkup for a life insurance policy has him convinced his days are numbered.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Mrs. Roper thinks her husband is having an affair when she finds his hidden stash of love letters , written to a woman named Doris.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen's mother comes for a visit. But later it is revealed that she has no place to go. So Helen and her two sisters get together to decide what to do, cause none of them really want her living with them.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen's luncheon makes her consider leaving the Cheviot Hills neighborhood. Stanley believes her and, without asking, has Jeffrey Brookes put their home on the market. Will The Ropers really relocate?

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: A man shows up and claims to be Stanley's son. Stanley admits to know his mother, but doesn't remember the night that she claimed to conceive her son. Roper goes to talk to a friend who was with him at the time to find out if the claims are true.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen adores the Brookes' boy, David, which leads her to feel she and Stanley could adopt a baby. Stanley is against it. Still, she calls an agency and sets up a home interview.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Stanley's going to be in trouble if Helen finds out he's lost her new puppy "Muffin" on a walk. He decides that a look-alike just might fool her and get him off the hook. Will Stanley get away with it or be barked at by Helen?

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: The clock Stanley gives Helen for their anniversary turns out to be stolen from Brookes' apartment.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: On the day that Helen is making dinner to impress her rich sister, Ethel, the utilities are cut off because Stanley forgot to pay the bills. He goes to great lengths to hide his mistake.
